title: Minimum Changes To Make Alternating Binary String - String - Easy - LeetCode
content:
You are given a string s consisting only of the characters '0' and '1'. In one operation, you can change any '0' to '1' or vice versa.
The string is called alternating if no two adjacent characters are equal. For example, the string "010" is alternating, while the string "0100" is not.

title: Check if Array Is Sorted and Rotated - Array - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Given an array nums, return true if the array was originally sorted in non-decreasing order, then rotated some number of positions (including zero). Otherwise, return false.
There may be duplicates in the original array.
Note: An array A rotated by x positions results in an array B

title: Maximum Swap - Array - Medium - LeetCode
content:
Given a non-negative integer, you could swap two digits at most once to get the maximum valued number. Return the maximum valued number you could get. Example 1:
Input: 2736
Output: 7236
Explanation: Swap the number 2 and the number 7.
Example 2:
Input: 9973
O

title: Sum of Unique Elements - Array - Easy - LeetCode
content:
You are given an integer array nums. The unique elements of an array are the elements that appear exactly once in the array. Return the sum of all the unique elements of nums.   Example 1: Input: nums = [1,2,3,2]
Output: 4
Explanation: The unique element

title: Maximum Number of Balls in a Box - Maths - Easy - LeetCode
content:
You are working in a ball factory where you have n balls numbered from lowLimit up to highLimit inclusive (i.e., n == highLimit - lowLimit + 1), and an infinite number of boxes numbered from 1 to infinity.

title: Beautiful Arrangement II - Maths - Medium - LeetCode
content:
Given two integers n and k, you need to construct a list that contains n different positive integers ranging from 1 to n and obeys the following requirement:
Suppose this list is [a1, a2, a3, ... , an], then the list [|a1 - a2|, |a2 - a3|, |a3 - a4|, ... , |an-1 - an|] has exactly k distinct

title: Latest Time by Replacing Hidden Digits - String - Easy - LeetCode
content:
You are given a string time in the form of hh:mm, where some of the digits in the string are hidden (represented by ?).
The valid times are those inclusively between 00:00 and 23:59.
Return the latest valid time you can get from time by replacing the hidden digits.

content:
There is a biker going on a road trip. The road trip consists of n + 1 points at different altitudes. The biker starts his trip on point 0 with altitude equal 0.

title: Number Of Rectangles That Can Form The Largest Square - Array - Easy - LeetCode
content:
You are given an array rectangles where rectangles[i] = [li, wi] represents the ith rectangle of length li and width wi.

title: Decode XORed Array - Array - Easy - LeetCode
content:
There is a hidden integer array arr that consists of n non-negative integers.
It was encoded into another integer array encoded of length n - 1, such that encoded[i] = arr[i] XOR arr[i + 1]. For example, if arr = [1,0,2,1], then encoded = [1,2,3].

title: Calculate Money in Leetcode Bank - Maths - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Hercy wants to save money for his first car. He puts money in the Leetcode bank every day.
He starts by putting in $1 on Monday, the first day. Every day from Tuesday to Sunday, he will put in $1 more than the day before. On every subsequent Monday, he will put in $1 more than the previous

title: Task Scheduler - Array - Medium - LeetCode
content:
Given a characters array tasks, representing the tasks a CPU needs to do, where each letter represents a different task. Tasks could be done in any order. Each task is done in one unit of time. For each unit of time, the CPU could complete either one task or just be idle.
